prompt: Alright! What are our next steps? things we should focus on? and what does the repo dictate we should use to achieve them? (subagent and infra wise). tysm! think hard. look at compaction summary
oh and... where are we at with the agents sdk?? how would that even work? wanna spawn a subagent to figure it out while you work on this other stuff? wdyt? best practices only. thx!

sounds sick! question tho... how do we get this to work with github? expliain in detail what a local workflow looks like now (and what it
  should/could look like according to best practices). Basically i want a better understanding of how everything flows, slash commands,
  hooks,... think hard about the best way to represent this... we could do ASCII diagrams, mermaid diagrams, and we want to make sure we
  have detailed docs... i guess, why don't you review the docs that the haiku scouts and you created earlier? and compare the current state
  of repo to those? and improve them and the claude.md to make sure everything is working properly...  and explain... for this particular request, what would be a good way to run it? plz advise. think hard. be cs tutor and senior code reviewer, documenter, educator. tysm! lmk how i can help

start by reconciling the claude_v3.md with claude.md... and move the old one to archive_old. then consider whether we want a claude.local.md? and think hard about the following questions:

- how do we (and why would we want to, with examples) implement the new skills.md. search the new anthropic docs about this.
- how do we implement mem0 with this? do we want to? what would it be helpful with and how could it slot in with the current flow? do we have hooks for it? would we use existing hooks? build new ones? i have a whole metadata schema in another repo... lmk if u wanna see
- we also have TS API connection to a docker based kanban task mgmt app called archon. thoughts on how that could slot in? i can share that info too... but let's put a pin in that for later (after mem0 at the very least if u think mem0 is a good idea)
- how do we use git (even if they're just local) worktrees as well as local commits as our edit undo? and how do we do so without mcp? don't we have slash commands that are deterministic for this? I think we want to leverage that to be true ballers no?

think hard about these things, and how that would affect parallelization... think hard, and lmk how i can help. appreciate u! tysm. launch subagents as needed to accomplish the above plz
can you explain each of the slash commands we have, and what they're for?

explain how yoru proposed slash command of adw_scout via skills is better and/or different than just using the current build_adw or plan_w_docs commands... go into each command in more detail as to what they actually do and how they work and can be used alone and together with examples... your explanations above are not very enlightening. thanks

explain how skills grow memories and where they're stored. and what the skills look like and where they're stored. create a skills folder or w/e it's supposed to be please and explain. thanks! and go ahead an implement that one skill you suggested earlier. we can later test it. tysm!
